text: It has been raining and all of your friends are splashing around in the puddles. What should you do?

options.text: Tell them to stop because they'll be cold and wet the rest of the day.
Not join in because you don't want to get soaked.
Encourage them to continue.
Join in.

text: Why should we stay seated in class?

options.text: It helps keep a classroom peaceful so we can all concentrate.
So we don't cause accidents by wandering around.
So it's harder for us to escape!
standing up is hard work.

text: Your friends invite you to play a game where you swing each other around by your coats. What do you do?

options.text: Tell a teacher what they are doing.
Think about how easy it would be to get hurt or ruin your coat before saying no.
Join in.
Get more people to play.

text: Why can breathing exercises be helpful?

options.text: It can take our mind off whatever is bothering us.
It lowers adrenaline and helps with anxiety.
It helps us hold our breath longer.
It uses up some of the air.
so we can ignore people asking for help.
It means we don't have to do work when we're meditating.
It helps us relax.
It makes us more aware of our thoughts and body.

text: At the start of a PE lesson, you are asked to spend five minutes doing whatever exercise you feel like. What do you do?

options.text: Do some of your yoga exercises.
Spend the time doing nothing and talk to your friend instead.
Do as little as possible.
Do some gentle warm ups and stretches.

text: Your teacher is asking for volunteers to help tidy the classroom at breaktime. What should you do?

options.text: Keep quiet and hope they don't pick you.
Volunteer to be helpful.
Volunteer but ask what you get out of it.
Complain that you shouldn't have to clean up mess you didn't make.

text: You fall over in the playground. It doesn't hurt too much and you aren't bleeding, wet and haven't even torn your clothes. What do you do?

options.text: Complain to a grown-up.
Walk it off.
Cry.
Carry on with whatever you were doing before.

text: You are playing a game with your friends and one of them wins by cheating. What do you do?

options.text: Call them something hurtful.
Tell them they can't play anymore and continue without them.
Explain that isn't fair on everyone else and ask them to play properly.
Tell a grown-up.

text: Your class are split into teams for a competition and your team doesn't win. What do you do?

options.text: Praise the winning team for their hard work.
Support the rest of your team.
Stomp off angrily.
Moan that you never win anything.
